summary: Strong historical precedent and broad condemnation suggest high probability (~85%) of UNGA resolution before Feb 1
content:
Key factors:

FOR (YES):
1. Historical precedent: 100% success rate (2/2) - Panama 1989 took 9 days, Grenada 1983 took 8 days
2. Timeline sufficient: 21 days remaining vs 8-9 days historically needed
3. Strong international condemnation including US allies (France, UK)
4. UN Secretary General explicitly said US violated UN Charter
5. UN experts condemned action on Jan 7, 2026
6. Similar circumstances: capture of head of state, military incursion

AGAINST (NO):
1. Some NATO countries support the intervention
2. No confirmed UNGA resolution scheduled yet (as of Jan 11)
3. Different context: Maduro more widely seen as illegitimate
4. Political dynamics different than Cold War era

Assessment: Historical precedent is very strong, timeline is adequate, condemnation is broad. The UNGA has always passed resolutions condemning US unilateral military interventions within ~1 week when there's broad condemnation. With 21 days left and even allies criticizing, this seems highly likely to happen.
